alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 13 at 1:56PM CDT until further notice by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Sumter. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 156 PM CDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Between 5 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Demopolis, Livingston, York, Cuba, Gainesville, Epes, Emelle, The University Of West Alabama, Bluffport, Boyd, Coatopa, Dug Hill, Kinterbish, Geiger, Lilita, Old Mallard Airport, Bellamy, Sumterville, Payneville and Ward.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
